title: Single slit - y-min when slit width doubles

content.question: Light from a laser shines through a narrow slit onto a screen a distance <math alttext="L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>L</mi></math> away where the light forms a diffraction pattern. The pattern’s minimum brightness that is adjacent to the central bright fringe is located a distance <math alttext="y sub 1 is much less than L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>y</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>≪</mo><mi>L</mi></math> from the middle of the center. The slit width is then doubled and, in the new pattern that is formed, the minimum that is adjacent to the central bright fringe is located a distance <math alttext="y sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>y</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> from the middle of the center. What is the ratio <math alttext="y sub 1 to y sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>y</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mi>y</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
